text: Is there a package that implements something like "save-lisp-and-die" which saves a system image that can be restarted later. Including of all functions compiled, all state, loaded external libraries, ...
i asked same thing several weeks ago. it is ideal to have it because it’s very useful to avoid starting from scratch and go straight to real work. so far, i did not get a good solution.

text: I feel like what could be done in Julia's user space involves better history management. If you could record the successful REPL for the current session you should be able then save that in a script and have PackageCompiler.jl function.
